snippet: NEW YORK - Two weeks before the Bahrain Grand Prix, the kingdom's attempts to project an image of calm were shattered on Friday when police fired tear gas at thousands of protesters in the capital. The race was canceled last year amid concerns about...
abstract: NEW YORK - Two weeks before the Bahrain Grand Prix, the kingdom's attempts to project an image of calm were shattered on Friday when police fired tear gas at thousands of protesters in the capital. The race was canceled last year amid concerns about a crackdown on dissent. Read the full article over on The Lede blog»

headline.main: Bahrain Activist's Hunger Strike Belies Image of Calm Ahead of Formula One
